sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"任命，委派"之意。
means: appoint ：通常指不经过选择的官方委任。
designate ：书面用语，侧重当权者或机构的选拔或任命，有时含强行指定的意味。
assign ：常指给一群人或个人分配、分派、指派或委派任务。
name ：普通用词，着重任命的结果，而不是过程。
nominate ：通常指为某一公职选择候选人，并将其提交给有决定权的人作最后决定。

sentence.Network_en: "Why didn't you appoint Ron twelve months ago?"—"Good question."
sentence.Network_cn: “你为什么12个月前不任命罗恩呢？”——“问得好。”

sentence.Network_en: He promised to appoint an AIDS czar to deal with the disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 他许诺任命一位艾滋病大使来应对这种疾病。

sentence.Network_en: Our plan is to allocate one member of staff to handle appoint-ments.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的计划是分派一位职员处理预约事宜。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... appreciate 欣赏 appoint 指定，任命 arrange 安排.
2013考研英语核心词汇_百度文库 ... apply 涂，敷 appoint 任命，委派 appraise 估量，估计.
字典中由字的解释 ... (7) 通“以”( yǐ)。用[ use] (9) 任用[ appoint] (11) 听凭;听任[ allow;let].
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... pointer n 指针；批示者 appoint v 任命，指派 disappoint v 使失望；受挫折.

list.abs: the other day的翻译中文意思-在线英汉词典 ... apparent solar day 视太阳日 appointed day 指定日期 Arbor Day [美]植树节.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(B) -亿城英语 ... by any possibility 可能 by appointment 按照约定 by bicycle 骑脚踏车.
失望就变成了上天的指示(His appointment)。所以说任何发生在你身上的事都是好的。
[精彩] 管理学必备英语词汇 - ChinaUnix.net ... fax machine 传真机 appointment book 记事簿 stapler 订书机.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French apointer, from a point 'to a point'

entry.def: If you appoint someone to a job or official position, you formally choose them for it.

example.ex: It made sense to appoint a banker to this job...
example.tran: 指派一位银行家做这份工作是明智之举。

example.ex: The commission appointed a special investigator to conduct its own inquiry...
example.tran: 委员会委派了一个特别调查员自行调查。

means.word_mean: 1. create and charge with a task or function;
2. assign a duty, responsibility or obligation to;

sentences.sentence: "She was charged with supervising the creation of a concordance"

auth_sentence.content: The emirates' rulers appoint the remaining council members.
auth_sentence.res_content: The emirates' rulers appoint the remaining council members.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The emirates' rulers appoint the remaining council members.

auth_sentence.content: Who will the winner appoint to his cabinet?
auth_sentence.res_content: Who will the winner appoint to his cabinet?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Who will the winner appoint to his cabinet?

auth_sentence.content: A power of appointment...includes a right to appoint...absolutely.
auth_sentence.res_content: A power of appointment...includes a right to appoint...absolutely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A power of appointment...includes a right to appoint...absolutely.

stems_affixes.word_buile: appoint[v.指定,任命]+ment表名词→n.约会, 指定
point点,变尖,指,针→n.点, 尖端, 分数 v.弄尖,指向,指出 v.指
point点,变尖,指,针+er表名词→尖的东西→指针

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使失望; 使受挫折;对……失信
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis不+appoint任命→不被任命→使失望
point点,变尖,指,针→n.点, 尖端, 分数 v.弄尖,指向,指出 v.指

Sentence.sentence: Pierre Salinger was appointed senator from California but subsequently lost his first election.

means.word_mean: 确定, 指定; 约定

sentences.en: We must appoint a day to meet again.
sentences.cn: 我们要约定好下次会面的日期。

sentences.en: He appointed the schoolhouse as the place for the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他指定校舍为开会地点。

sentences.en: The head of the workshop appointed that the work should be finished in two days.
sentences.cn: 车间主任下令这项工作必须在两天之内完成。

jushi.english: The decorator appointed the hotel with ultramodern furnishings.
jushi.chinese: 这位装修工用极其现代化的陈设装饰这家旅馆。

jushi.english: He applied for the job and was appointed.
jushi.chinese: 他申请做那个工作并得到了委任。

jushi.english: We must appoint a day to meet again.
jushi.chinese: 我们要约定好下次会面的日期。
